translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Jñānagupta

source_sentence: 捨宮出家品下
translation: The Chapter on Renouncing the Palace and Leaving Home

source_sentence: 「爾時，車匿既聞太子如是語已，自心思惟：『聖子今者，決欲出家，
translation: Having heard these words of the prince, Chanda thought to himself:

source_sentence: 不肯住也。』
translation: They won't stay.'

source_sentence: 如是念已，故發大聲大言大語，問太子言，望使宮人覺知：『太子聖子！
translation: After this thought, he therefore raised a loud voice and spoke in great words, asking the prince what he said, hoping to let the palace staff know, 'Noble son of the prince!

source_sentence: 恒常知諸時節所作之事，常依順時，今是何時，而喚索馬？
translation: He always knows what he does at the appropriate times and always follows the proper time. When is the right time now for him to call out to a horse?

source_sentence: 聖子若欲往詣園林觀看善地遊戲之者，此非其時，何用馬為？
translation: If the holy child wants to go to a park, look out for a good place, and play in it, this is not the right time; why would he need a horse?

source_sentence: 聖子今日無有怨讐，復無違逆反叛之人，四方安靜，復無有人擾攘離亂，
translation: Today the holy prince has no enemies or enemies, and there are no opponents or adversaries. The four quarters are peaceful; there is no disturbance or disorder in anyone in any direction.

source_sentence: 邊壃一切無有逃亡，外方隣邦亦無侵奪，欲共聖子鬪戰之者，聖子覆蓋一切大地，
translation: They want to fight with the holy child, but the holy child covers all the earth.

source_sentence: 唯一無二，今何假須馬王乾陟？
translation: They are only one and not two, so why would they need the king of horses or drymen?

source_sentence: 聖子今日此處宮內，諸婇女等共相圍遶，歡娛受樂，猶如天主歡喜園中，
translation: The holy prince is now in the palace, surrounded by court ladies and women. They are delighted to play and enjoy themselves just as if they were in the heavenly king’s joyful park.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因，共諸天女，周匝圍遶；
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, was surrounded by heavenly maidens.

source_sentence: 聖子亦然，在此宮內，寶床上坐，何用於馬？
translation: So it is with the holy prince, who's sitting here in the palace on a precious bed, so why should he use horses?

source_sentence: 但願安心，於此百千婇女之中，聽作音聲娛樂而住。』
translation: I simply wish to be at ease, so that among these hundreds of thousands of lustful women, they'll hear sounds and amuse themselves and stay here.'

source_sentence: 是時車匿，口如是言，又復以手，拔諸婇女頭髮令寤，又以脚蹋彼婇女身，
translation: Chanda then said these words, and again he pulled out the hair on the bodies of the impure women’s hair with his own hands and stepped on their bodies with his feet.

source_sentence: 但彼婇女不覺不知，以上諸天神通力故。
translation: But that promiscuous woman doesn't perceive or know it because of the supernormal powers of the gods above.

source_sentence: 「『同生車匿汝當知，　　我觀宮內如塚墓，
translation: You should know that I observe the palace inside like a tomb.

source_sentence: 亦似蛆虫穴無異，　　如與羅剎同共居，
translation: It's like living together with a maggot or wormhole, just like living together with a rāṣa.

source_sentence: 東西南北狼籍眠，　　又類受胎初泡水。
translation: The eastern, western, southern, and northern wolves sleep, and they're similarly subject to the first bubble of water in the womb.

source_sentence: 車匿我見五慾苦，　　心意不願在此宮，
translation: Chanda, I see the suffering of the five desires And do not wish to be in this palace.

source_sentence: 若遊諸方我不喜，　　以見老病及死屍。
translation: If you travel in various directions, I won't rejoice because I see old people, illnesses, and dead corpses.

source_sentence: 車匿速將乾陟來，　　我今決欲出家去。』
translation: Chanda quickly brings the gandharva, and now I'm determined to leave home.'

source_sentence: 爾時，太子心內生疑畏眾人覺，私密細聲，以於此偈告車匿言：「爾時，
translation: At the time, the prince had doubts within his mind and feared that the crowd would awaken. He spoke privately and subtly to Chanda in these verses, saying:

source_sentence: 車匿聞於太子如是言已，猶如猛獸著於毒箭，生大苦惱，大聲而哭，白太子言：『聖子！
translation: After hearing these words from the prince, Chanda said, 'It's like a fierce animal clinging to a poisonous arrow that causes great pain and distress, cries out loudly, and says to the prince, 'Noble son!

source_sentence: 今可捨諸尊乎？』
translation: Now, can we abandon the honored ones?'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『善生車匿！
translation: The prince replied, 'Splendid, Chanda!

source_sentence: 我今欲求勝上之處，寧捨現前諸尊親族，勿令未來我及眷屬入於死命鬼口之中。』
translation: Now, if I want to pursue the superior place, I'd rather abandon my present honored relatives and not allow future self and my retinues to enter the mouth of a death-and-living ghost.'

source_sentence: 「『我當求於涅槃故，　　寧捨親族向出家，
translation: 'I should seek nirvāṇa, so I'd rather abandon my family members and leave home.

source_sentence: 未來死鬼劫奪人，　　命一入口悉食盡。』
translation: In the future, ghosts and evil demons will plunder people, and their lives will all die in a single mouthful of food.'

source_sentence: 更為車匿而說偈言：「爾時，車匿重聞太子如是言已，復更慇懃白太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: Again, Chanda said in verse, At that point, Chanda heard the prince repeatedly say this, and then he spoke to the prince again, saying, 'Great noble prince!

source_sentence: 一切世人謂言：「太子決定得作大轉輪王。」
translation: All the people in the world said, The prince will surely become a great wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 云何欲捨？』
translation: How do you want to abandon it?'

source_sentence: 太子又斷車匿此言：『咄汝車匿！
translation: The prince again cut off Chanda and said, 'Duh, you Chanda!

source_sentence: 莫如是語！
translation: Don't say such a thing!

source_sentence: 我昔在於兜率天上，勝於此處，曾作天王，悉領於彼三十三天，我於是時，
translation: Formerly I was in Tuṣita Heaven, surpassing this place. Once I was the king of heaven and ruled over all the thirty-three gods there.

source_sentence: 猶不樂於彼處之樂。
translation: They still don't delight in the pleasures of those places.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以見生死無常患故，況復今日此人間乎？
translation: It's because they see birth and death as impermanent and distressing, so why wouldn't they be here today?

source_sentence: 少時在於此人境界，多有患濁，處此王位，雖復治世，暫時自在，而不得離病死之怖。
translation: For a little while he lived in the realm of humans, where there were many afflictions and turbidities. When he ascended the throne he governed the world for a short time but could not free himself from the fear of sickness and death.

source_sentence: 但世間中，有死命鬼治世之處，彼之諸王即不能得自在安樂。』
translation: But in the world, there are death-and-living ghosts who rule the world, and those kings won't be able to attain unimpeded peace and comfort.'

source_sentence: 車匿復更報太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: Chanda again reported to the prince, saying, 'O great sage prince!

source_sentence: 雖復太子不用世位，但淨飯王今已年老，太子盛壯，勿令大王心生苦惱。』
translation: Although the prince doesn't use worldly status, King Śuddhodana is now old and powerful, so don't let the great king's mind become painful and distressed.'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『善生車匿！
translation: The prince replied, 'Splendid, Chanda!

source_sentence: 我今於此大父王邊，心生愛敬，如父愛我，我倍愛父，大王奇特，敬愛親族，
translation: I now have feelings of affection and respect for my great father, the king. Just as my father loves me, so do I love him even more. Your majesty, it is most wonderful that you should esteem me as your kinsman.

source_sentence: 我亦不欲捨諸親族，我於親眷亦復不作諸餘異心。
translation: I also don't want to abandon my relatives, and I don't have any other different thoughts about my family members.

source_sentence: 但我大畏，大怖大驚，諸有之中受生死苦，今日欲求解脫法故，而暫捨離所愛重親，
translation: But I am greatly fearful and terrified. Among all living beings I experience the suffering of birth and death. Today, in order to seek liberation, I have temporarily abandoned my beloved relatives.

source_sentence: 當來世中能愍救護諸眷屬故，又未來世不相離故。』
translation: In future lives, they'll be able to rescue their dependents and protect them, and in future lives they won't part from each other.'

source_sentence: 「爾時車匿白太子言：『大聖太子心決定耶？
translation: It was then that Chanda said to the prince, 'Is the great noble prince's mind determined?'

source_sentence: 要須捨俗求出家乎？』
translation: Do you need to abandon the secular and leave home?'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『善生車匿！
translation: The prince replied, 'Splendid, Chanda!

source_sentence: 我已立要。』
translation: I've established the essentials.'

source_sentence: 車匿又言：『為何事故？』
translation: Chanda also said, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我見世間無常過故，意欲專求彼勝處耳。』
translation: The prince answered, 'Because I see the world as impermanent and faultless, I want to focus on that superior place.'

source_sentence: 車匿復問：『以何緣故，覓彼勝處？』
translation: Again, Chanda asked, 'For what reason did you look for that superior place?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『若使世間，無生無死，無老無病，無愛別離，無怨憎會，
translation: The prince answered, 'If the world were free of birth and death, no old age and illness, no love and separation, and no association of enemies and foes,

source_sentence: 得王位已，受諸功德，無有無常，境界真實，一生人中，無有濁穢；
translation: Having attained the throne of kingship, they receive virtues that are neither existent nor impermanent; their realms are real. In one rebirth among humans there will be no dirt or stain.

source_sentence: 若如是者，可令我於此處心樂。
translation: If that's the case, it will cause me to be happy here.

source_sentence: 汝善車匿！
translation: You, good charioteer!

source_sentence: 莫違我心，我已勅汝，急速被帶我同日生馬王乾陟。』
translation: Don't disobey my mind; I've commanded you to quickly be carried and born on the same day as me, King Kaṇṭhaka of horses.'

source_sentence: 車匿白言：『如太子勅，不敢有違。』
translation: Chanda said, 'Suppose the prince commands that he doesn't dare disobey it.'

source_sentence: 其車匿聞太子如是勅語言已，亦識太子深心之意，亦復先知淨飯王勅嚴制禁重，
translation: Having heard these words of the edict, Chanda also knew the prince’s deep thoughts. He also knew that King Śuddhodana had imposed a strict rule forbidding him from eating food.

source_sentence: 但以諸天神力加故，發心欲取乾陟將來太子之前。
translation: It was only because of the supernatural powers of the gods that they aroused the intention to take Kaṇṭhaka and bring him before the prince.

source_sentence: 「『車匿以天神力加，　　忍違大王勅命制，
translation: 「『車匿以天神力加, 忍違大王勅命制,

source_sentence: 兼以菩薩昔願滿，　　發意遂取馬莊嚴。』
translation: It's also because the bodhisattva fulfilled his past vows, and he arouses his intention to take the horse's adornment.'

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「爾時車匿即至厩中，於槽櫪上，搦取乾陟，即以純金，作迦毘遮，
translation: There was a verse that said, At that point, Chanda went to his stable, took the dried-up cheese from the pot and made it into a kabhiṣka out of pure gold.

source_sentence: 七寶莊嚴，串於馬口。
translation: Adorned with the seven kinds of treasure, it was placed at the mouth of a horse.

source_sentence: 牽出離槽，別繫餘橛，刮刷其背，先以柔軟輕細之物屧於脊上，以金所成七寶莊嚴鞍韀而被，
translation: He pulled out the tray, separated it from the cauldron, tied it to another piece of cloth, scraped and brushed its back. First, he covered his back with soft, light, and fine pieces of cloth, and covered it with a sad

source_sentence: 上覆金網。
translation: It's covered with a gold net on top.

source_sentence: 如是具足被帶馬已，即牽將向太子之前。
translation: After he had been fully covered with his horse, he led it to the prince's presence.

source_sentence: 是時乾陟同生馬王，遙見太子身力壯故，遍體歡喜，出大鳴聲。
translation: At the time, Gandhāra was the same as the co-arisen horse king, and when he saw the prince's physical strength from a distance, he rejoiced all over his body and produced a loud sound.

source_sentence: 時，其乾陟馬王吼喚出聲之時，聞半由旬；
translation: At that time the king of the gandharva horses roared and cried out, and half a yojana in distance was heard.

source_sentence: 時首陀會一切諸天，以神力故，令此馬聲隱沒不聞，恐畏有人障礙太子不得出家。
translation: At the time, all the gods in the Sudarśana assembly used their supernormal powers to cause this horse's voice to be hidden and not heard, fearing that someone might prevent the prince from leaving home.

source_sentence: 「是時太子，歡喜踊躍遍滿其體，即以右手，柔軟網縵，手指猶如蓮花葉赤色如紫礦，
translation: Then the prince, pervading his body with joy and ecstasy, placed his right hand on a soft, webbed finger just like lotus blossom leaves, red-colored like purple ore.

source_sentence: 摩拭馬王脊背之上而勅語言：『汝同日生乾陟馬王！
translation: Mahākauṣṭhila put it above the king's back and commanded him to say, 'You'll be born on the same day as King Kaṇṭhaka!'

source_sentence: 我今欲求甘露之法，汝須努力，如是善行，勿令有人作我障礙。
translation: Now that I want to seek the ambrosia of the Dharma, you must exert effort and thus perform good deeds so that no one will become an obstacle to me.

source_sentence: 汝善乾陟！
translation: You're good, dried-up!

source_sentence: 鬪戰之時，尚出死力，欲勝他故，今日與我，善為佐助，求出世樂。
translation: At the time of battle, he was still suffering from the power of death and wanted to overcome others. So today he gave it to me as a good ally in order to provide him with worldly happiness.

source_sentence: 世間之樂，暫時歡喜，不久還失，生大憂惱。
translation: The happiness of the world is temporarily rejoicing, but it won't be long before it returns and becomes lost, causing great grief and distress.

source_sentence: 為法出力，此事甚難，我今欲為一切世間求解脫故，出家修道。
translation: It's very difficult because of the power of the teaching that I want to leave home and cultivate for the sake of liberation in all the worlds.

source_sentence: 汝善努力，出勇猛筋，捷疾而行。
translation: You have exerted yourself well, producing the muscle of courage and going quickly.

source_sentence: 我今出家，為諸世間及汝等輩作大利益。』
translation: Now that I've left home, I'll create great benefits for the world and you people.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子正念立地，發大弘願，作如是言：『此我最後在家乘也，
translation: “At that time, the prince stood on the ground in correct mindfulness and made a great aspirational prayer, saying:

source_sentence: 我從今去，更不復乘如是之乘。』
translation: From now on, I won't ride such a vehicle again.'

source_sentence: 發誓願已控[革*必]，即乘乾陟馬上，乘已重語乾陟馬言：『汝乾陟馬！
translation: Having made this vow, he controlled [Ge*ji] and rode on the horse of a gandharva, and after riding it, he spoke to the gandharva horse again, saying, 'You gandharva horse!

source_sentence: 努力負我，最後負荷，我今為諸天人世間作利益故，發心出家。』
translation: They strive to bear the burden on me, and I'll bear the final burden; now, for the sake of benefiting gods and humans in the world, I arouse the intention to leave home.'

source_sentence: 太子亦坐乾陟馬王鞍上之時，一切無量阿脩羅眾，迦婁羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、羅剎眾，
translation: When the prince was also seated on the saddle of the horse king Gandhāra, all the assemblies of the innumerable asuras, the kālôdayin, kiṃnara, mahoraga, and rāṣas,

source_sentence: 毘舍遮、地居諸天及首陀會，乃至阿迦膩吒天等，隨逐乾陟馬王而行。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa, the earth-dwelling gods and the śūdra assemblies, up to the Akaniṣṭha gods, and so forth, traveled along with the king of the gandharvas and horses.

source_sentence: 是時諸天手持白蓋，復以種種諸寶莊嚴蓋柄周匝，以諸眾寶真珠羅網，
translation: The gods then held the white canopies in their hands, surrounded by various ornamented canopies and handles made of jewels, draped with nets of all kinds of precious pearls.

source_sentence: 懸於其上，其網目間，悉懸金鈴，擎持以覆太子之上。
translation: On top of it, he hung a golden bell hanging from the distance between his retinue and eyes, holding it to cover the prince.

source_sentence: 是時太子乘乾陟馬，漸向宮門。
translation: The prince then rode on a dry horse and gradually headed for the palace gate.

source_sentence: 乾陟行時，蹄足聲聞一俱盧奢，首陀會天以神通力，隱彼鳴聲不令遠聞，
translation: When the gandharva was on his way, he had one krośa of śrāvakas riding at his feet. The Sudarśana gods used their supernatural powers to hide the sound and prevent distant hearers from hearing it.

source_sentence: 畏有障礙太子出家。
translation: Fearing that there would be an obstruction, the prince left home.

source_sentence: 「是時太子出家之時，其虛空中有一夜叉，名曰鉢足，彼鉢足等諸夜叉眾，
translation: “At the time, when the prince renounced household life, there were night yakṣas in the sky named Padmavyūha.

source_sentence: 在虛空中，各以手承馬之四足，安徐而行。
translation: In the sky, they each carried the four feet of their horses in their hands and walked quietly.

source_sentence: 太子初欲發足出家，有一天子，唱如是言：『願善吉利大法船師，今欲度脫無量眾生於煩惱海。』
translation: When the prince first wanted to give rise to the intention to leave home, a celestial being called out, 'May Sunetra, the great Dharma boat master, now want to liberate measureless sentient beings from the ocean of afflictions.'

source_sentence: 復有一天，唱如是言：『願無障礙大聖世尊，今欲出家渡生死海。』
translation: Again, another god called out in this way, saying, 'May the Bhagavān, the unobstructed great sage, now want to leave home and cross the ocean of birth-and-death.'

source_sentence: 「是時，太子語車匿言：『善生車匿！
translation: The prince then spoke to Chanda, saying, 'Sir, good-natured Chanda!

source_sentence: 汝今可在我前而行，示現我道。』
translation: Now, you can walk in front of me and show me the path.'

source_sentence: 出宮內門，彼門關鑰，欲開之時，其聲聞於一拘盧奢。
translation: He exited through the inner gate of the palace, which was locked; and when he wished to open it, the śrāvaka stayed in one krośa.

source_sentence: 非人至門開彼關鑰，其開之時，首陀會天以神通力，隱蔽彼聲不令人聞，
translation: When a non-human being arrives at the door and opens the lock, the Sudarśana gods of the assembly use their supernormal powers to hide that sound so that no one can hear it.

source_sentence: 恐畏太子出家之時有諸障礙。
translation: I'm afraid there will be obstacles when the prince leaves home.

source_sentence: 是時車匿白太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: Chanda then said to the prince, 'Great sage prince!

source_sentence: 宮門已開。』
translation: The palace gates have been opened.'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『門已開也，決定我心所願求利，必當得成，無有疑慮。』
translation: The prince replied, 'The door has already opened, so I'm certain that what I want in my mind to seek profit will surely be accomplished without any doubt.'

source_sentence: 「爾時車匿白太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: It was then that Chanda said to the prince, 'Great sage prince!

source_sentence: 希有甚奇！
translation: That's rare and marvelous!

source_sentence: 此之宮門，以前開時，大用氣力而方得開，聖子今者至已即開。』
translation: When the gates of this palace were previously opened, it was only possible to open them with great effort, and now that the noble son has arrived, he'll open them.'

source_sentence: 大聖太子亦至門邊，譬如猛風吹彼雲隊開散兩邊。
translation: The great sage prince also went to the side of the gate, just as a strong wind blows and those clouds scatter on both sides.

source_sentence: 是時太子，從內宮門出於外已，作是唱言：『此我最後出於宮門，從今已去，
translation: Then the prince came out of the inner gate of the palace and said, “This is my final departure from the inner gate of the palace.

source_sentence: 當更不出。』
translation: They won't come out again.'

source_sentence: 「爾時太子從宮出已，安庠而至毘耶囉門，其門邊有一夜叉將，名曰善入，
translation: “Then the prince departed from the palace, settled in peace, and arrived at Vaiśravaṇa’s gate. Beside the gate was a night-shark general named Sudarśana,

source_sentence: 共其五百夜叉眷屬，既見太子安庠徐步向門而來，見已各各共相謂言：『今此悉達大聖太子，
translation: When the five hundred attendants saw the prince approaching the door, they all said to each other, “This is the great holy prince Siddhārtha.

source_sentence: 夜半非時來向門下，我等今者欲為彼不？』
translation: At midnight, at an ungodly hour, he came down to the door and said, Do we want to do it now?'

source_sentence: 時夜叉眾各相謂言：『我等可為太子開門，隨彼稱意東西行動，脫彼如心，
translation: The assembly of yakṣas then said to each other, “We should open the door for the prince’s arrival. Act according to his wishes and go east or west in order to free him just as he wished.

source_sentence: 所願成就，得甘露道。
translation: Having fulfilled his vow, he attained the path of immortality.

source_sentence: 既自證已，復為天人世間，當得作大利益。』
translation: After realizing it for themselves, they'll again attain great benefit for gods and humans in the world.'

source_sentence: 是時善入夜叉之將，急疾開彼毘耶囉門。
translation: He then entered the general of the yakṣas and quickly opened the Vaiśravaṇa gate.

source_sentence: 其門已前開閉之時，其聲鳴徹，至半由旬。
translation: When the doors were opened and shut, their sound penetrated as far as half a yojana.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，以神通力隱蔽門聲，不使諸人得聞其響，恐為太子作出家障。
translation: The Śuddhāvāsa gods then used their supernormal powers to hide the sound of the door and didn't allow people to hear it, lest they create a home obstruction for the prince.

source_sentence: 「太子從此迦毘羅城毘耶囉門初出之時，彼門所有守門諸將，或有執捉關鑰之者，
translation: “When the prince came out of Kapilavastu at the first watchtower of Vaiśravaṇa, some of the generals guarding the watchtower’s gates or those holding the keys to the fence were there.

source_sentence: 彼等諸人，或著睡眠，不覺太子出彼宮時；
translation: Those people might be addicted to sleep and not realize that the prince is coming out of their palace.

source_sentence: 或復是彼諸夜叉神之所迷惑，或是諸天神力迷惑，所有最慎，善持更人，
translation: Perhaps they're deluded by those yakṣa spirits, or the gods are deluded by their supernormal powers. The most cautious among them will be able to maintain it for another person.

source_sentence: 彼等一切悉重睡眠，不覺人出。
translation: All of them are deeply asleep, and they don't feel people emerging.

source_sentence: 「爾時，欲界魔王波旬，見於太子初出家時，為欲恐怖於太子故，以神通力，
translation: “At the time, Māra King Pāpīyān of the realm of desire saw that when the prince had first renounced household life, because he wanted to frighten the prince, he used his supernatural powers to cause him to do so.

source_sentence: 化作諸聲，所謂虛空出現大雲，雲中復更出大雷聲，及霹靂聲。
translation: The apparition produces various sounds, called great clouds appearing in space, and within those clouds are also the sounds of thunder and lightning.

source_sentence: 更復化作諸大水河，吹於大石，出沒奔流。
translation: Again, they transformed into large rivers of water that blew on the huge rocks and flowed up and down.

source_sentence: 太子之前，復作大山，其山高峻，現大崖岸。
translation: Before the prince, he built another great mountain, which was so high that it appeared to be the shore of a large cliff.

source_sentence: 又復化作大猛火聚，炎爀熾然。
translation: Again, they'll be transformed into a great heap of fierce fire that's blazing hot and furious.

source_sentence: 「爾時淨居諸天，以神通力，隱彼大雲，雷電霹靂一切諸聲，及彼大山、河石、高峻崖岸、猛火，
translation: “At that time the gods of the Pure Land, by their supernatural powers, concealed the great clouds, thunder and lightning, all the sounds of thunder and lightning, as well as the great mountains, rivers, rocks,

source_sentence: 皆令不現。
translation: They all cause them to be unmanifest.

source_sentence: 將彼魔王波旬，擲著無量百千由旬之外，勿使障礙太子出家。
translation: Take that Māra King Pāpīyān and tosss him beyond measureless hundreds of thousands of yojanas, so that he won't prevent the prince from leaving home.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子從城門出，至外邊已，迴身觀看迦毘羅城，出師子吼唱如是言：『我今寧自擲棄身形，
translation: “Then the prince came out of the city gates. Having arrived at the outer edge, he looked around the city of Kapilavastu in reverse and said to the lion, ‘I should throw away my body!

source_sentence: 墮大石崖，飲諸毒藥，而取命終，亦不飲食；
translation: They fell into a great rocky cliff and drank various poisonous medicines, but at the end of their lives they did not eat or drink.

source_sentence: 若我未得隨心願求度脫眾生於生死海，我終不入迦毘羅城。』
translation: If I haven't yet attained the desire to follow my heart and liberate sentient beings from the sea of birth and death, I won't enter the city of Kapilavastu.'

source_sentence: 其諸天聞太子如是師子吼聲，皆悉隨喜。
translation: When those gods heard the prince thus roar the lion's voice, they all rejoiced.

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子出此師子吼聲之時，所有守護迦毘羅城諸鬼神等，或守城門，
translation: “At the time, when the prince produced this lion’s roar, all the guardian spirits of Kapilavastu guarded the gates of the city.

source_sentence: 或守牆壁，或守敵樓，皆悉大唱如是之言：『如是如是！
translation: Whether guarding walls or enemy towers, they all sing aloud and say, 'So it is!'

source_sentence: 願如太子所出師子無畏吼聲，成就滿足。』
translation: May it be like the sound of the lion's fearless roar produced by the prince, accomplished and fulfilled.'

source_sentence: 以歡喜心，各舉兩手，語大子言：『大勇健兒！
translation: With joy, they each raised their two hands and said to the great child, 'Great brave man!

source_sentence: 出已迴觀迦毘羅城。』
translation: After emerging, he returns to observe the city of Kapilavastu.'

source_sentence: 「是時太子聞此言已，不驚不怖，以歡喜心，身毛皆竪，更作是言：『此城我今終不迴入，
translation: Having heard these words, the prince was neither frightened nor terrified. On hearing them, his body hair stood on end in joy and he said, “I will not return to this city.

source_sentence: 若我得於甘露之句諸聖所歎，已斷生死煩惱之流，證涅槃道，然後乃入。』
translation: If I attain the phrase of ambrosia that's praised by the sages and have cut off the stream of afflictions of birth-and-death and realized the path to nirvāṇa, then I'll enter it.'

source_sentence: 太子城外出此師子吼言要誓，證彼真實真如菩提，然後還來入城教化，
translation: The prince went out of the city, made this lion’s roar and uttered these essential vows to realize enlightenment as it really was. Then he came back and entered the city to edify [the Buddha].

source_sentence: 出此聲處，在後諸人造作於塔，名曰太子出師子吼。
translation: The place where this sound is produced is called the place where the prince produces the lion's roar, and the people behind him build a stūpa named Prince Producing the Lion Roar.

source_sentence: 「『若人欲伐於樹木，　　要必當盡其根本，
translation: 'If someone wants to cut down a tree, they must surely destroy its roots.

source_sentence: 如斫物頭須斷絕，　　渡水宜令達彼岸，
translation: It's like a frog whose head must be cut off, crossing water to make it reach the other shore.

source_sentence: 言語一竟不得虛，　　作怨亦訖莫復喜。』
translation: When words are one, they can't be false, and when enemies are made, they don't rejoice.'

source_sentence: 而彼處所有一最大尼拘陀樹，彼樹有神，其神以偈語太子言：「爾時，
translation: And there was a great nyagrodha tree in that place. That tree had a spirit, and the spirit spoke to the prince in verse:

source_sentence: 「『雪山處所可動移，　　海水或使其枯竭，
translation: 'There's a place where the snowy mountains can move, and the water in the ocean might cause them to dry up.

source_sentence: 虛空可令崩落地，　　我吐言語終不虛。』
translation: Space can be made to crumble and fall, but my words are never false when I speak.'

source_sentence: 「『此處今出大藥王，　　當治眾生煩惱毒，
translation: 'Now that a great king of medicine has emerged here, he will cure sentient beings with the poison of afflictions.

source_sentence: 若有被愛箭所射，　　此匠今悉能拔除。
translation: If there's anything that's shot by a craving arrow, this craftsman can now remove it.

source_sentence: 此處今出大醫尊，　　善治一切眾生患，
translation: Here now emerges the great physician honored One, Who skillfully cures the afflictions of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若人有老病死疹，　　此設療治悉能愈。
translation: If a person has the rash of old age, illness, and death, he'll be cured if he treats it.

source_sentence: 此處今出大智炬，　　燭彼顛倒癡眾生，
translation: This is the place where the great torch of knowledge now emerges, Illumining those deluded sentient beings.

source_sentence: 所在愚瞑黑闇中，　　即皆覩見大光照。
translation: Where they are in the darkness of ignorance, They all see great light shining brightly.

source_sentence: 此處今出大顯赫，　　能為世間作大明，
translation: This place now produces great glory, Able to make great light for the world.

source_sentence: 以智圓滿慧眼光，　　普照十方諸境界。
translation: With the light of the eye of knowledge perfecting wisdom, They illumine all realms in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 此處今出大船師，　　當度未度眾生類，
translation: This is where the great ship captain comes out now, Who will save all sentient beings who have not yet been saved.

source_sentence: 牢裝方便智舟艥，　　濟度無量億天人。
translation: Laden with the canopies of skillful means and wisdom, he saves measureless millions of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 此處今出大商主，　　欲教一切度大磧，
translation: This is the place where the great merchant lord now emerges, intending to teach everyone to cross the great desert.

source_sentence: 所有迷惑無量眾，　　示導令從正路行。
translation: All the boundless multitudes of deluded beings They show and lead, Causing to follow the right path.

source_sentence: 此處今出是大王，　　世間法王無上王，
translation: This place now emerges as a great king, the supreme king of the Dharma king of the world.

source_sentence: 建立法幢大法相，　　令知是法及非法。
translation: Establishing the great characteristics of the Dharma banner, he makes them know what’s true and what’s not.

source_sentence: 此處今出是大導，　　能伏一切諸世間，
translation: This is where the great Guide comes forth, Able to overpower all worlds.

source_sentence: 其未調伏諸天人，　　一切當能善調伏。
translation: Those who haven't yet subdued gods and humans will all be able to well subdue them.

source_sentence: 此處今出是大主，　　出世法主無上主，
translation: This place now emerges as a great lord, the world-transcendent Dharma lord and unsurpassed lord.

source_sentence: 當轉微妙大法輪，　　摧伏一切諸外道。
translation: You will turn the subtle wheel of the great teaching And overthrow all heretics.

source_sentence: 此處今出是大覺，　　當覺世間未覺者，
translation: This place now produces this great awakening, which will awaken those in the world who haven’t yet awakened.

source_sentence: 其有被諸煩惱纏，　　能斷一切縛令脫。
translation: Those who are bound by the afflictions can cut off all bonds and be freed.

source_sentence: 此處今出大帝幢，　　當雨無邊大法雨，
translation: This is the place where the great emperor’s banner now emerges; It will rain the boundless, great rain of truth.

source_sentence: 十力具足世無雙，　　能降一切諸外道。
translation: Endowed with the ten powers, unsurpassed in the world, They can subdue all heretics.

source_sentence: 此處今乘大白象，　　得度無明遠廣磧，
translation: This place is now riding a great white elephant to cross the vast desert of ignorance.

source_sentence: 執持利智金剛杵，　　當破外道一切邪。
translation: Holding the vajra of sharp wisdom, he'll destroy all the errors of non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 此處今出大梵王，　　憐愍世間一切眾，
translation: This is where the great king of Brahmā now appears, Compassionate to all beings in the world.

source_sentence: 為利愚騃眾生輩，　　當鳴大法鍾螺鼓。
translation: In order to benefit foolish sentient beings, he'll sound the great dharma bell and conch drum.

source_sentence: 此處今出是大龍，　　當雨世間大法雨，
translation: This is the place where this great dragon now emerges, who will rain down the great dharma rain of the world.

source_sentence: 潤益三界諸眾生，　　除其熱惱諸邪病。』
translation: It nourishes sentient beings in the three realms and removes their feverish and wrong illnesses.'

source_sentence: 太子以偈報彼護樹神言：「爾時，淨居諸天而說偈言：「爾時淨居諸天說此偈已，
translation: The prince answered the tree guardian god in verse, saying: At that time the gods of the holy land spoke these verses:

source_sentence: 即口稱言：『南無尊者大丈夫身。』
translation: He then verbally called out, saying, 'Honorable, the body of the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 禮拜太子，隨太子行。
translation: He paid homage to the prince and followed him.

source_sentence: 時淨居天各隨先業果報所得微妙之身，威德勇猛，志力精進，難作已作，
translation: Each of the Śuddhāvāsa gods then attained a subtle body that was derived from the results of past actions, majestic and courageous, determined and energetic, difficult to do and already done.

source_sentence: 為於太子，放身光明，滅除暗瞑，顯示道路，譬如重雲日從中出放大光明，
translation: For the sake of the prince, he emanated a ray of light from his body to extinguish darkness and obscurity and show the roads. It was as if a heavy cloud were rising from the sunlight emitting from the midst of it.

source_sentence: 如是如是。
translation: So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 淨居諸天從其身體放諸光明，為於太子，示現道路，亦復如是。
translation: The gods of the Pure Land emanated rays of light from their bodies to show the prince the path, just as they did.

source_sentence: 「爾時欲界諸天子等，皆各化作端正可喜摩那婆身，在太子前引導太子平坦道路。
translation: At the time, the celestial beings in the desire realm each transformed themselves into a delightful Manabha body and guided the prince on the flat path before the prince.

source_sentence: 「大梵天王共諸梵眾眷屬圍遶，在於太子右邊而行。
translation: “The great Brahmadeva king, surrounded by the Brahmas and their retinues, was walking to the right of the prince.

source_sentence: 「忉利天王共諸釋眾三十三天眷屬圍遶，在於太子左邊而行。
translation: The king of Trāyastriṃśa gods, surrounded by the thirty-three heavenly retinues of the Śākya clanspeople, advanced to the left of the prince.

source_sentence: 「四大天王各以種種微妙瓔珞，莊嚴其身，以妙天冠莊嚴其首，垂諸瓔珞，
translation: The four great celestial kings each adorned their bodies with various exquisite jewelry, adorned their heads with beautiful celestial crowns, and draped all kinds of jewelry.

source_sentence: 復共無量乾闥婆眾、鳩槃茶眾、諸龍夜叉，無量百千，左右圍遶。
translation: He was also accompanied by an immeasurable number of gandharvas, kumbhāṇḍas, nāgas, and yakṣas, surrounded by innumerable hundreds of thousands of them.

source_sentence: 身帶種種堅牢鎧甲，手執弓箭，或執利劍，或執長刀，或執鐵棒，或執矛戟，
translation: His body was armed with various strong and fastened armor; he held a bow and arrow in his hand, or might hold a sharp sword, or a long sword, or an iron stick, or a halberd.

source_sentence: 或執三叉，執槊執鈎，擎持排楯，在太子前，引導而行，語太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: Or they may take the trident, carry a hammer, hold a hook, lift an shield, and walk in front of the prince, saying to the prince, 'Great noble prince!'

source_sentence: 從於此道，速行莫住。』
translation: From this path, quickly follow it and don't stay there.'

source_sentence: 上虛空中，復有無量無邊諸天百千億眾，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其身，不能自勝。
translation: In the sky above, there are measureless and limitless hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of multitudes of celestial beings, filling their bodies with joy and ecstasy, unable to control themselves.

source_sentence: 將天水陸所生之花，散太子上，并及旃檀、諸妙沈水、多伽羅等天諸末香，
translation: He scattered the flowers grown from heavenly water and land on the prince’s feet, as well as heavenly powdered incense such as sandalwood, exquisitely sheltered water, and tāla.

source_sentence: 自餘更有種種雜香，散太子上，復有塗香末香燒香，太子行時，各各手持散太子上，
translation: The other incenses themselves had various mixed fragrances that were scattered over the prince, and there were also perfumes of ointment, powdered incense, and burning incense. When the prince was walking, each hand held a scented

source_sentence: 以用供養於太子故。
translation: It's because they used it to make offerings to the prince.

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子宮內所有婇女睡寤，忽然唱言：『不見太子！
translation: At that point, the nymphlike women inside the palace fell asleep and suddenly cried out, 'I don't see you, prince!'

source_sentence: 不見太子！』
translation: Don't you see the prince!'

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅既覩臥床獨自一身，不見太子，而大唱叫作如是言：『嗚呼嗚呼！
translation: Yaśodharā, lying cross-legged on his own body alone, did not see the prince and cried out loudly, saying:

source_sentence: 我等今被聖子誑逗。』
translation: Now, we're being tormented by the noble son.'

source_sentence: 即大叫喚，以身投地，把撮塵土，以散頭上，又舉兩手，自拔髮毛，拗折打破身諸瓔珞，
translation: He then cried out in a loud voice, dropped to the ground with his body, picked up dirt and dirt, scattered it over his head, lifted his hair by both hands, and broke all the necklaces on his body.

source_sentence: 以撲於地，以手指爪[爬-巴+國]裂四支、身體皮肉，所著衣服，皆悉掣毀。
translation: He pounced it on the ground, and with his fingernails and nails [climbed-pa+koṭika] he split the four limbs and skin and flesh of his body. All the clothes he wore were thrown away.

source_sentence: 舉聲大哭，出於種種酸楚痛言，又以諸餘種種苦惱，逼切縈纏自身支體。
translation: They raised their voices and cried out in great wailing, uttering various kinds of painful words, and they were also tormented by other kinds of pain and suffering that tethered their own limbs and bodies.

source_sentence: 「爾時，宮內婇女侍人奏淨飯王，作如是言：『大王當知，今夜睡寤不見太子。』
translation: At the time, the palace's courtesy maidservant told King Jīvaka, saying, 'Great king, you should know that tonight I'm sleeping and don't see the prince.'

source_sentence: 其當馬人既失乾陟，亦復諮奏淨飯王言：『大王當知，今夜厩上亦復不見馬王乾陟。』
translation: The horseman then lost his gandharva and also asked the king of Jīvaka, 'Great king, you should know that tonight's stable doesn't see the king of horses, Kandharva.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，大聲叫喚而口唱言：『嗚呼嗚呼！
translation: After hearing these words, King Śuddhodana called out in a loud voice and said, 'Ahoy, ahoy!

source_sentence: 我所愛子。』
translation: My beloved child.'

source_sentence: 如是唱已，悶絕倒地，傍臣手持栴檀冷水以灑其上，少時還穌，復其本心。
translation: After he had thus chanted, he fainted and fell to the ground. The attendant minister held sandalwood in his hand and sprinkled it with cool water. After a little while he regained consciousness and went back to his original mind.

source_sentence: 然後召喚防守城將而勅之言：『卿等速疾莊嚴四兵善著鎧甲，速求太子，
translation: Then he summoned the guardian general of the city and commanded him, saying: All of you, quickly adorn your fourfold army with well-armored armor.

source_sentence: 令知所在。』
translation: I'll make them know where they are.'

source_sentence: 時彼防衛守城將軍，聞王如是嚴重勅己，從宮內出，遍告諸餘大征將言：『汝等諸將各各當知！
translation: When the general of the city guards heard that the king had thus imprudently instructed himself, he emerged from his palace and told the other great generals, 'You generals, you should each know!'

source_sentence: 淨飯大王有如是勅：「所在境界，百官大臣，其有受食我封祿者，或有依我而活命者，
translation: The great king Jīvaka had this decree: In the sphere of his domain, there are a hundred officials and ministers who will accept my salary or rely on me for their livelihood.

source_sentence: 如是人輩皆悉集聚，速疾分頭行求太子。
translation: Such a group of people all gathered together, quickly moving their heads and feet to solicit the prince.

source_sentence: 若得見者，善言慰喻，勿聽住彼山林磎谷，迎將迴還。」』
translation: If you get to see them, speak well and comfort them, don't allow them to stay in those mountains, forests, or valleys, and they'll be welcomed and returned.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，百官諸群臣等，聞彼防衛守城將軍如是言已，即時各於迦毘羅城內外衢道，
translation: “At that time, when the hundreds of thousands of officials and ministers heard these words from the generals of the army guarding the city walls, they immediately set out to cross the streets inside and outside the city walls of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 振鈴告言：『汝等一切所有臣民，食於淨飯大王國土封祿之者，及依大王而活命者，
translation: They rang the bell and said: All of you ministers, eat those who are enthroned in the land of King Śuddhodana and those who live by relying on the king.

source_sentence: 諸臣百官悉皆速出迦毘羅城，為求太子。
translation: The ministers and hundred officials all quickly left the city of Kapilavastu to seek the prince.

source_sentence: 若得見者，慰喻教迴，還入宮中。』
translation: If he sees it, he'll be comforted and taught to return back into the palace.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，釋種諸臣百官，并及一切迦毘羅城所居人民，其有食祿及不食者，
translation: At the time, the Śākyamuni clan had ministers and hundreds of officials, as well as all the people living in Kapilavastu, who were paying their salaries and those who didn't.

source_sentence: 皆從城出，行求太子。
translation: They all came out of the city in search of the prince.

source_sentence: 「爾時，守城大臣，遍告所行諸人如是言已，漸次至於太子當馬大臣之家，
translation: “At that time the minister of the guardian of the city, pervading all the citizens who lived therein, said these words and gradually arrived at the house of the prince’s attendant minister Ma.

source_sentence: 是故我知決定當得成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，決定當轉無上法輪。
translation: Therefore, I know that I'll surely attain supreme perfect enlightenment and will surely turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 車匿！
translation: Chanda!

source_sentence: 我今實言向汝而說，車匿！
translation: I will now tell you the truth, Chanda!

source_sentence: 我今寧被刀割身肉，寧食毒死，寧入大火，寧投大崖，寧自剄死，我今終不未得免離生死之法而還向家。
translation: I would rather be cut off by a sword than eat poison and die. I would rather enter a great fire than fall into a great cliff. I would rather burn myself to death. But now I am unable to escape the law of birth-and-death

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?
